events.originalText: King Faisal of Saudi Arabia was shot and killed by his nephew Faisal bin Musaid.
events.subtitle: Faisal of Saudi Arabia
events.headline: King Faisal of Saudi Arabia assassinated by nephew Faisal bin Musaid

events.originalText: Meteorologists at Tinker Air Force Base in Oklahoma City, United States, issued the world's first tornado forecast after noticing conditions similar to another tornado that had struck five days earlier.
events.subtitle: Tinker Air Force Base
events.headline: Tinker Air Force Base issues world's first tornado forecast

events.originalText: Enrico Fermi published his discovery of neutron-induced radioactivity, for which he was later awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics.
events.subtitle: Enrico Fermi
events.headline: Enrico Fermi awarded Nobel Prize for neutron-induced radioactivity discovery

events.originalText: The Triangle Shirtwaist Factory fire (pictured) in New York City killed 146 sweatshop workers, many of whom could not escape because the doors to the stairwells and exits had been locked.
events.subtitle: Triangle Shirtwaist Factory fire
events.headline: Triangle Shirtwaist Factory fire kills 146 in New York City

events.originalText: The Scottish National Antarctic Expedition  anchored in the South Orkney Islands with the intention of establishing the first weather station in Antarctic territory.
events.subtitle: Scottish National Antarctic Expedition
events.headline: Scottish National Antarctic Expedition establishes first weather station in Antarctic territory

events.originalText: The Slave Trade Act became law, abolishing the Atlantic slave trade in the British Empire.
events.subtitle: Slave Trade Act 1807
events.headline: Slave Trade Act abolishes Atlantic slave trade in British Empire

events.originalText: Jacobite risings: A French fleet anchored near Fife Ness as part of a planned French invasion of Britain.
events.subtitle: Jacobitism
events.headline: French fleet anchors near Fife Ness for planned invasion of Britain

events.originalText: Dutch astronomer Christiaan Huygens discovered Titan, the largest natural satellite of Saturn.
events.subtitle: Christiaan Huygens
events.headline: Christiaan Huygens discovers Titan, largest natural satellite of Saturn

events.originalText: Wars of the Roses: A formal reconciliation ceremony between the Lancastrians and Yorkists led to a brief period of peace.
events.subtitle: Wars of the Roses
events.headline: Reconciliation ceremony leads to peace in Wars of the Roses

events.originalText: The Yongle Emperor (pictured) of Ming China launched the first of his military campaigns against the Mongols, resulting in the fall of the Mongol khan Bunyashiri.
events.subtitle: Yongle Emperor
events.headline: Yongle Emperor launches military campaign against Mongols

events.originalText: Byzantine emperor Theodosius III abdicated in favour of Leo the Isaurian after he captured Theodosius's son.
events.subtitle: Byzantine Empire
events.headline: Theodosius III abdicates in favor of Leo the Isaurian

events.originalText: Constantine (pictured) was selected as one of the last popes of the Byzantine Papacy; he would be the last pope to visit Constantinople (now Istanbul) until Paul VI in 1967.
events.subtitle: Pope Constantine
events.headline: Constantine selected as one of last popes of Byzantine Papacy
